holdings.text: Whether loss is incidental to the operation of a business is a question of fact to be decided on the facts of each case, having regard to the nature of the operations carried on and the nature of the risk involved in carrying them out. precedents.case_name: Arunachalam Chettiar v. Commissioner of Income-tax Madras
precedents.cited_proposition: money is stock-in-trade or circulating capital of the banker

precedents.case_name: Commissioner of Income-tax, Madras v. Subramanya Pillai
precedents.cited_proposition: in money-lending business moneys lent are stock-in-trade and bad debts are loss of stock-in-trade

precedents.case_name: Motipur Sugar Factory, Ltd. v. Commissioner of Income-tax, Bihar Orissa
precedents.cited_proposition: losses in respect of stock-in-trade allowed as trade losses

precedents.case_name: Raghuvanshi Mills Ltd. v. Commissioner of Income-tax, Bombay City
precedents.cited_proposition: payment from insurance company for stock destroyed by fire is trading receipt

precedents.case_name: Ramaswami Chettiar v. Commissioner of Income-tax, Madras
precedents.cited_proposition: losses in respect of stock-in-trade allowed as trade losses

precedents.case_name: Green H. M. Inspector of Taxes v. J. Gliksten and Son, Ltd.
precedents.cited_proposition: payment received from insurance company for stock destroyed by fire taken as trading receipt

precedents.case_name: Pohoomal Bros. v. Commissioner of Income-tax, Bombay City
precedents.cited_proposition: loss by destruction of stock-in-trade by enemy invasion is trading loss

precedents.case_name: Hira Lal Phoolchand v. Commissioner of Income-tax, C.P., U.P. and Berar
precedents.cited_proposition: loss incurred in stock-in-trade by ravages of white-ants allowed as trading loss

precedents.case_name: Badridas Daga v. Commissioner of Income-tax
precedents.cited_proposition: deduction admissible if loss arises out of carrying on of business and incidental to it
precedents.cited_holding: loss by misappropriation by agent incidental to business

precedents.case_name: Ramaswami Chettiar v. The Commissioner of Income-tax, Madras
precedents.cited_proposition: loss by theft from business premises not allowed if thieves not employees

precedents.case_name: Charles Moore and Co. W. A. Pvt. Ltd. v. Federal Commissioner of Taxation
precedents.cited_proposition: robbery of takings on way to bank is incidental loss as banking takings necessary part of business
precedents.cited_holding: loss by armed robbery on way to bank deductible

precedents.case_name: Gold Band Services Limited v. Commissioner of Inland Revenue
precedents.cited_proposition: robbery at service station premises deductible as incidental to business

precedents.cited_proposition: involuntary outgoings and losses incidental to trade deductible regardless of frequency
